Imagine a cube, five feet on a side. Imagine it filled with water. Now, imagine that water, more than 10,000 pounds of it, soaking your favorite cotton t-shirt and jeans.
Between 900 and 1,500 gallons of water are needed to grow the cotton for a single pair of jeans. (A t-shirt needs about 250.) Multiply that by the 450 million pairs of jeans sold in the United States every year, and that's more than 450
title: How Much Water Are You Wearing in Your Clothes?
author: ChiaLynn
